Marilyn_Stasio_Gets.title: Marilyn Stasio Gets Cozy With Some Unlikely Heroines — and a Hit Man
Marilyn_Stasio_Gets.description: This week’s Crime column features a mom who runs a spy operation and a female medical student in 19th-century Edinburgh. Also a hit man turned P.I.
Marilyn_Stasio_Gets.author: By MARILYN STASIO

A_Cannibal_a.title: A Cannibal, a Dead Viscount and a Case of Stolen Sand
A_Cannibal_a.description: Marilyn Stasio’s Crime column features a new and gruesome Lucas Davenport novel and the latest appearance of Parnell Hall’s cantankerous murder-solving puzzle lady.
A_Cannibal_a.author: By MARILYN STASIO

Philip_Kerr’s_Last.title: Philip Kerr’s Last Novel and a New Series From Alexander McCall Smith
Philip_Kerr’s_Last.description: Marilyn Stasio’s Crime column features Bernie Gunther’s final appearance in Berlin and introduces a delightfully eccentric Swedish sleuth.
Philip_Kerr’s_Last.author: By MARILYN STASIO

Going_Rogue_With.title: Going Rogue With Marilyn Stasio
Going_Rogue_With.description: This week’s Crime column features novels about bad-boy cops and suburban serial killers, then offers an escape to scenic Provence.
Going_Rogue_With.author: By MARILYN STASIO

From_Drug_Cartels.title: From Drug Cartels to the Mafia, Crime Runs in the Family
From_Drug_Cartels.description: Marilyn Stasio’s latest Crime column showcases Mexican thugs, Brooklyn mob wives, a dutiful Mississippi son and an aristocrat whose adoption scheme turns deadly.
From_Drug_Cartels.author: By MARILYN STASIO

Stalkers_and_Dead.title: Stalkers and Dead Wedding Guests: The Latest in Crime Novels
Stalkers_and_Dead.description: Marilyn Stasio’s column covers new books from established crime-writing giants, like Jonathan Kellerman, and a newcomer, Alex Michaelides.
Stalkers_and_Dead.author: By MARILYN STASIO

Marilyn_Stasio’s_Crime.title: Marilyn Stasio’s Crime Column Exhumes the Murderous Past
Marilyn_Stasio’s_Crime.description: New novels take readers back to Tudor England (C.J. Sansom), 1920s England (Charles Todd) and the age of Queen Victoria (Mick Finlay).
Marilyn_Stasio’s_Crime.author: By MARILYN STASIO

Beware_Strange_Psychologists.title: Beware Strange Psychologists: The Latest in Crime Novels
Beware_Strange_Psychologists.author: By MARILYN STASIO

Back_to_the.title: Back to the Bayou: James Lee Burke’s Latest Novel
Back_to_the.description: In her Crime column, Marilyn Stasio also heads to Bel-Air (Thomas Perry), Florida (Tim Dorsey) and Detroit (Stephen Mack Jones).
Back_to_the.author: By MARILYN STASIO

Best_Crime_Novels.title: Best Crime Novels of 2018
Best_Crime_Novels.description: Marilyn Stasio’s picks from the year’s mysteries — for the most original murder method, the toughest puzzle, the creepiest setting, even the loudest bang for the buck.
Best_Crime_Novels.author: By MARILYN STASIO
